member.name: T:ceTe.DynamicPDF.Merger.MergeDocument
member.summary: Represents a document that can merge and append other documents.
member.remarks: This is the primary class used to merge or append entire PDF documents or certain pages from existing documents. The merge document can be output to any object derived from the class that supports writing and can easily be integrated with ASP.NET to stream the document to Internet Information Server's HTTP output stream.

member.name: T:ceTe.DynamicPDF.Merger.MergeOptions
member.summary: Represents options for merging PDF documents.
member.remarks: Currently the only merge option is whether or not to preserve the form fields on the PDF being merged in. Specifying true will keep the form fields on the merged PDF where specifying false will remove the form fields from the PDF.

member.name: M:ceTe.DynamicPDF.Merger.MergeOptions.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A value indicating if form fields should be merged.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A value indicating if form fields should be merged.
The root form field that all merged form fields will be placed under.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if form fields should be merged.

member.summary: Gets or sets the root form field.

member.summary: Represents the merger settings for a document.

member.name: T:ceTe.DynamicPDF.Merger.PdfDocument
member.summary: Represents a PDF document for import.
member.remarks: This class should be used when you will be referencing an existing PDF document more than once. Using a PDFDocument is more efficient than specifying a file path because the document will not need to be parsed again on each subsequent reference. This class is safe for multithreaded operations.
